page.title: 20In Conclusion
page.content: The people of the area could not have been more helpful to us. They are friendly and co-operative. It is not typical perhaps of a normal Cornish village and surrounding country area as most of the people travel to the larger towns to work. Also, the farms are mostly managed for people or groups based outside the area. However, the people still have that local attitude to life that makes them fairly content and happy without the stresses of city life. Hopefully, the area will not slip back too far as shop closures threaten and the fate of it's river (commercial shipping used to come right up but now it is silted right over) not a foretaste of it's future.
